cases.associated_technology: the summary explains that the plaintiff’s filings "improperly employed ai-generated content, including fake legal citations." the court "addressed multiple motions related to procedural defaults and improper use of artificial intelligence in filings" and "granted united airlines' motion to strike berg's responses to its motion for summary judgment because they were untimely and improperly employed ai-generated content, including fake legal citations." the court noted that "nonnie berg tried to submit documents to the court late and used an ai to help write them. the ai gave her fake legal information, making her filings invalid." plaintiff used ai to draft filings, which contained fabricated legal citations and violated court filing rules, leading to the striking of her summary-judgment responses. individual passenger or employee plaintiff airline corporation and additional defendants
